Details: 1 ICRC international (British) staff kidnapped Nov 10 and released unharmed Nov 14.
2 NGO national staff shot and killed.
2 INGO national staff detained and held by FARC overnight.

2 INGO international (1 British, 1 Dutch) staff kidnapped by ELN in the Norte de Santander, with demands that the govt turn over the body of leader Wildemar Castro. Treated well and released unharmed.
A local staff member attacked by multiple assailantson his way to the office. His arm was injured.

One INGO national male staff was attacked and injured while walking his dog with his partner. Reports indicate he was robbed, but the civilian perpetrators also used homophobic language during the attack.
One female UN staff member was sexually assaulted in her home.
One international INGO staff member was kidnapped by unknown armed men in Toribio, Cauca, at an illegal checkpoint and released 2 days later.
One UN staff member was attacked and robbed in Monteria, Cordoba by unknown criminals. He was treated at a nearby hospital.
One national INGO driver was killed by unknown armed people in Antioquia.
One UN national official was drugged with scopolamine and robbed in a taxicab in Bogotá. A laptop and other valuable belongings were stolen.
One NNGO aid worker was injured after stepping on an anti-personnel mine in Tumaco, Nariño.
One NNGO aid worker was kidnapped by a non-identified NSAG in Colombia. The aid worker was released the next day due to community pressure. The NGO suspended activities after the incident.
One female national INGO aid worker was drugged and injured during a robbery in a bus in Bogota, capital district.
One international male aid worker was drugged and robbed in Bogota, capital district.
One national female UN aid worker was injured when five criminals attacked her to rob her belongings around Loma de la Cruz in Cali, Valle del Cauca.
One NRCS aid worker was shot and killed while off-duty by unknown armed men in Orito, Putumayo for suspected personal reasons.
